resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#issuecomment-1133511544

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

wjones127 commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r879568931


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed

Review Comment:
   ```suggestion
   **Acero** (pronounced AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed
   ```



##########
docs/source/cpp/streaming_execution.rst:
##########
@@ -35,20 +34,23 @@ For many complex computations, successive direct :ref:`invocation of
 compute functions <invoking-compute-functions>` is not feasible
 in either memory or computation time. Doing so causes all intermediate
 data to be fully materialized. To facilitate arbitrarily large inputs
-and more efficient resource usage, Arrow also provides a streaming query
-engine with which computations can be formulated and executed.
+and more efficient resource usage, the Arrow C++ implementation also
+provides Acero, a streaming query engine with which computations can

Review Comment:
   ```suggestion
   provides Acero (pronounced AH-serr-oh), a streaming query engine with which computations can
   ```

jonkeane commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r881864500


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** (pronounced AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed

Review Comment:
   ```suggestion
   **Acero** (pronounced ʌˈsɜroʊ) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed
   ```
   
   Suggestion to use IPA if we are providing a pronunciation guide (also the stress is the second syllable, yeah?)

wjones127 commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r881890497


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** (pronounced AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed

Review Comment:
   I think you are right about the second syllable being stressed. Never got past linguistics 101.
   
   IPA is more precise, but is it recognizable to most people? I'd personally have to copy and paste the IPA into a reader to get it.

westonpace commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r881941411


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** (pronounced AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed

Review Comment:
   If we're modeling after the [Spanish word](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%C3%A1cero) then it seems we would want `ˈa.se.ɾo` but I agree I've been pronouncing it internally as `ʌˈsɜroʊ` (`Uh-serr-oh`).
   
   I also agree with Will that IPA is somewhat intimidating to the layman.  Perhaps we can do both versions?

wjones127 commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r882078137


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** (pronounced AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed

Review Comment:
   Pronunciation is hard; the word exists across many languages and dialects. This is what it sounds like to me: `[ˈa.sɜ.ɾo]` 🤷 
   ```suggestion
   **Acero** (typically pronounced [ˈa.sɜ.ɾo] / AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed
   ```
   
   Or maybe just don't provide a guide 🤦

jonkeane commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r882186029


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** (pronounced AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed

Review Comment:
   This is the (former) linguist in me showing, but TBF, the other systems of pronunciation all rely on some pretty heavy base dialect being known (e.g. some are for North American English, some are for UK English and they don't necessarily overlap!) to the point that they are almost meaningless at conveying the pronunciation outside of a particular group of English speakers. That being said, pragmatically, if we have both that's fine, so long as the IPA is one of them 😝 
   
   You'ld still want to move the stress to the second syllable in both I think  `[a.ˈsɜ.ɾo] / ah-SERR-oh` right? Also, to 🚲 🏠 this even more, I vote we don't put the syllable breaks in the IPA (it's toootally kosher to leave them out) so we can _gloss over_ the complexities in syllabification rules for English rhotics (and then the fact that the two guides differ in which syllable gets the `r` isn't noticeable 🙈 )

westonpace commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r885056924


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** (pronounced AH-serr-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows computation to be expressed

Review Comment:
   I've updated to use both, changing the stress to the second syllable.  Please confirm this is what was desired.

jonkeane commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r885730327


##########
docs/source/cpp/overview.rst:
##########
@@ -66,6 +66,9 @@ reference.
 **Kernels** are specialized computation functions running in a loop over a
 given set of datums representing input and output parameters to the functions.
 
+**Acero** (pronounced [aˈsɜɾo] / ah-SERR-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows

Review Comment:
   ```suggestion
   **Acero** (pronounced [aˈsɜɹo] / ah-SERR-oh) is a streaming execution engine that allows
   ```
   
   This is fantastic, thanks! 
   
   One very very minor update to the r sound in IPA. /ɾ/ is a flap (what ts and ds are frequently reduced to), and the original /r/ is common in quick transcriptions of English, but not technically accurate, since it's a trilled r like in (many dialects of) Spanish.
   
   Everything else looks good to me!

jonkeane commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r885938591


##########
docs/source/cpp/streaming_execution.rst:
##########
@@ -35,20 +34,23 @@ For many complex computations, successive direct :ref:`invocation of
 compute functions <invoking-compute-functions>` is not feasible
 in either memory or computation time. Doing so causes all intermediate
 data to be fully materialized. To facilitate arbitrarily large inputs
-and more efficient resource usage, Arrow also provides a streaming query
-engine with which computations can be formulated and executed.
+and more efficient resource usage, the Arrow C++ implementation also
+provides Acero (pronounced AH-serr-oh), a streaming query engine with which computations can

Review Comment:
   ```suggestion
   provides Acero, a streaming query engine with which computations can
   ```
   
   I think we only need the pronunciation in the overview, but if we do want it here we should copy what's up there too

westonpace commented on code in PR #13207:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13207#discussion_r886172548


##########
docs/source/cpp/streaming_execution.rst:
##########
@@ -35,20 +34,23 @@ For many complex computations, successive direct :ref:`invocation of
 compute functions <invoking-compute-functions>` is not feasible
 in either memory or computation time. Doing so causes all intermediate
 data to be fully materialized. To facilitate arbitrarily large inputs

-engine with which computations can be formulated and executed.
+and more efficient resource usage, the Arrow C++ implementation also

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: There is some desire on the mailing list to name the C++ execution engine.  Although there isn't really any code impact from such a change we should update our documentation to refer to the engine by name.
fields.summary: [C++] Name the C++ streaming execution engine
